title: Cash withdrawal impact on M1, M2

content.question: Fred Jones withdraws <math alttext="$1,000" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1,000</mtext></math> in cash from his savings account. What immediate effect does this transaction have on the monetary aggregate measures of <math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M1</mtext></math> will increase; <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M2</mtext></math> will decrease
<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M1</mtext></math> will increase; <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M2</mtext></math> will not change
<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M1</mtext></math> will decrease; <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M2</mtext></math> will not change
<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M1</mtext></math> will not change; <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M2</mtext></math> will decrease
<math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M1</mtext></math> will not change; <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M2</mtext></math> will not change

content.answer: <math alttext="M 1" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M1</mtext></math> will not change; <math alttext="M 2" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M2</mtext></math> will not change

topic.text: 4.3: Definition, Measurement, and Functions of Money

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
